name: Dyno Readings
body: # # Individual JSP Program My individual JSP program for this project is a CRUD database for a place to record vehicle dynometer readings. The source code for this program can be found in my GitHub repository here. ![](https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xlp1/v/l/t34.0-12/12319691_10203935057775386_1465943919_n.jpg?oh=58bc631edcf7196c9094fab2e142d0c1&oe=566314B0) After creating the dyno record database, you can add a new record using the create page. ![](https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfa1/v/t34.0-12/12348590_10203935057815387_1214354724_n.jpg?oh=ee3de1b84c988681754eb5c332713c48&oe=5662FE54) Once you add all of the entries you want, you can view the current database entries by retrieving the records. ![](https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xlf1/v/t35.0-12/12333076_10203935057895389_1952114886_o.jpg?oh=da4d4fb5efa2eaa0d9b515c8970c7508&oe=566332C5) If there are any entires with incorrect information, you can edit them using "update dyno record". ![](https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfp1/v/t35.0-12/12342985_10203935057855388_1082062351_o.jpg?oh=9281a7d402e180da340a6b4c20d96599&oe=56633DAC) The final process you can use for the database is to delete a record. ![](https://scontent-ord1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xap1/v/t34.0-12/12325184_10203935057735385_207898729_n.jpg?oh=cab27c39d6dc32ad9b56fc9e031b1c67&oe=56635827)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
